data.title: Awful films: Every Zero-Star Film Ever Reviewed in Halliwell's Film Guides--Part III (ALL those listed alphabetically from [Marked Woman] 'Lady Gangster' to 'Strange Bargain')
data.meta_description: A list of 3,200 films compiled on Letterboxd, including Lady Gangster (1942), Maroc 7 (1967), Marquis (1989), Marquis de Sade: Justine (1969) and Marquise (1997). About this list: Halliwell's zero-star entries, from both 'Halliwell's 2008 Film Guide' and 'Halliwell's: The Movies That Matter', were far too numerous, and to be able to add notes, etc., to Part II, I needed to stop it at 3200 titles and start this Part III. It officially starts, alphabetically, with, under [Marked Woman], 'Lady Gangster' and goes to 'Strange Bargain'. As I have concluded putting the entries from 'The Movies That Matter' on the lists, I've worked out the percentages--Here goes!: Awful: 41.45% (143 of the 345) Fair: 26.96% (93 of the 345) Good: 22.03% (76 of the 345) Great: 7.54% (26 of the 345) Masterpiece: 2.03% (7 of the 345) As I've completed the entries from the book, the percentages are as follows (for the 21168 entries of the 2008 Film Guide): Awful: 11882 (or 56.13%) Fair: 5904 (or 27.89%) Good: 2212 (or 10.45%) Great: 869 (or 4.11%) Masterpiece: 301 (or 1.42%) Titles listed in the volumes that WEREN'T in Letterboxd: Marry Me Again (Frank Tashlin, 1953) Martha, Ruth & Edie (Norma Bailey, Deepa Mehta and Danièle J. Suissa; 1988) Meet Me at Dawn (Peter Creswell and Thornton Freeland, 1946) Meet Mr. Penny (David MacDonald, 1938) Meet the Navy (Alfred Travers, 1946) The Melody Lingers On (David Burton, 1935) Men in Her Diary (Charles Barton, 1945) Men of Tomorrow (Leontine Sagan and Zoltan Korda, 1932) Men of Yesterday (John Baxter, 1936) Merry Comes to Town (George King, 1937) Merton of the Movies (James Cruze, 1924) Michael and Mary (Victor Saville, 1931) The Michigan Kid (Ray Taylor, 1947) The Middle Watch (Norman Walker, 1930) Millions in the Air (Ray McCarey, 1935) [Les Miserables] The Bishop's Candlesticks (George Abbott, 1929) Mrs. Fitzherbert (Montgomery Tully, 1947) The Missing Rembrandt (Leslie S. Hiscott, 1932) Mission in Morocco (Carlos Arévalo and Anthony Squire, 1959) The Monk (Francisco Lara Polop, 1990) The Morals of Marcus (Miles Mander, 1936) [Moscow Nights] Les nuits moscovites (Alexis Granowsky, 1934) Mountain Music (Robert Florey, 1937) Murder at Monte Carlo (Ralph Ince, 1934) Murder in the Family (Albert Parker, 1938) Murder in Trinidad (Louis King, 1934) My Heart Is Calling (Carmine Gallone, 1935) My Wife's Family (Monty Banks, 1931) My Wife's Family (Walter C. Mycroft, 1941) My Wife's Family (Gilbert Gunn, 1956) The Mystery of Edwin Drood (Timothy Forder, 1993) The Naked Earth (Vincent Sherman, 1958) Nanou (Conny Templeman, 1986) The Night of Nights (Lewis Milestone, 1939) Night of the Garter (Jack Raymond, 1933) No Funny Business (Victor Hanbury and John Stafford, 1933) No More Women (Albert S. Rogell, 1934) No Parking (Jack Raymond, 1938) [Not So Dumb] Dulcy (Sidney Franklin, 1923) Not Wanted on Voyage (Maclean Rogers, 1957) A Notorious Gentleman (Edward Laemmle, 1935) The Notorious Sophie Lang (Ralph Murphy and William Cameron Menzies, 1934) [Number Seventeen] Number 17 (Géza von Bolváry, 1928) The Nursemaid Who Disappeared (Arthur B. Woods, 1939) O Mary This London (Season 10, Episode 5 TV-movie from 15-season, 163-episode TV-series 'Screen Two'; Suri Krishnamma, 1994) Oasis (Yves Allégret, 1956) Obsessed (TV-movie; Robin Spry, 1989) Offending Angels (Andrew Rajan, 2000) Old Iron (Tom Walls, 1938) Old Mother Riley 6: In Business (John Baxter, 1941) Old Mother Riley 5: In Society (John Baxter, 1942) Old Mother Riley 10: Detective (Lance Comfort, 1943) Old Mother Riley 9: Overseas (Oswald Mitchell, 1943) Old Mother Riley 11: At Home (Oswald Mitchell, 1944) On Approval (Tom Walls, 1930) On Stage Everybody (Jean Yarbrough, 1945) On Such a Night (Ewald André Dupont, 1937) Once in a Blue Moon (Ben Hecht and Charles MacArthur, 1936) The Oracle (C.M. Pennington-Richards, 1952) Our Neighbours the Carters (Ralph Murphy, 1939) Out of the Blue (Gene Gerrard, 1931) The Outsider (Harry Lachman, 1931) Paris (Clarence G. Badger, 1929) Paris by Night (David Hare, 1988) Parker (Jim Goddard, 1984) Partners in Crime (Ralph Murphy, 1937) People Will Talk (Alfred Santell, 1935) [Pierre of the Plains] Heart of the Wilds (Marshall Neilan, 1918) [Pierre of the Plains] Over the Border (Penrhyn Stanlaws, 1922) The Pleasure Principle (David Cohen, 1991) [Poil de Carotte] Carrot Top (Paul Mesnier, 1952) Premiere (Walter Summers, 1938) Private Angelo (Michael Anderson and Peter Ustinov, 1949) Private Izzy Murphy (Lloyd Bacon, 1926) [Private Izzy Murphy] Sailor Izzy Murphy (Henry Lehrman, 1927) Purple Heart Diary (Richard Quine, 1951) A Question of Adultery (Don Chaffey, 1958) Rackety Rax (Alfred L. Werker, 1932) Rainbow 'Round My Shoulder (Richard Quine, 1952) Raise the Roof (Walter Summers, 1930) Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm (Alfred Santell, 1932) Rendezvous 24 (James Tinling, 1946) Renegade (TV-movie from 'Fighting Cage' parts 1 and 2 [Season 1/Episodes 21 and 22] from 5-season, 111-episode TV-series; Ralph Hemecker and R. Marvin, 1993) Resurrection (they have Edwin Carewe's 1927 version, but not his 1931 one) The Reunion (Larry Eudene, 1998) Rhythm Serenade (Gordon Wellesley, 1943) Rich Man's Folly (John Cromwell, 1931) [The Ringer] The Gaunt Stranger (they had Walter Forde's 1938 version, also called The Phantom Strikes, but not the 1931 one) A Romance in Flanders (Maurice Elvey, 1937) Romance in the Dark (H.C. Potter, 1938) [The Room of Words] La stanza delle parole (Halliwell states the director's Joe D'Amato but IMDb says Franco Molè, 1989) [Rose Marie] Rose-Marie (Lucien Hubbard, 1928) Rough Diamonds (Halliwell's has the director as Christopher Lee but IMDb lists Donald Crombie; 1994) A Royal Divorce (Jack Raymond, 1938) Said O'Reilly to McNab (William Beaudine, 1937) Salute John Citizen (Maurice Elvey, 1942) Sandy Gets Her Man (Otis Garrett and Paul Girard Smith, 1940) Scandal Street (James P. Hogan, 1938) The Scarlet Letter (USA; no director given, 1910) The Scarlet Letter (Joseph W. Smiley and George Loane Tucker, 1911) The Scarlet Letter (David Miles, 1913) The Scarlet Letter (Carl Harbaugh, 1917) The Scarlet Letter (USA; no director given, 1920) The Scarlet Letter (Challis Sanderson, 1922) Scattergood Baines (Christy Cabanne, 1941) [Scattergood Baines] Scattergood Pulls the Strings (Christy Cabanne, 1941) [Scattergood Baines] Scattergood Rides High (Christy Cabanne, 1942) School for Husbands (Andrew Marton, 1937) The School for Scandal (Maurice Elvey, 1930) Schweik's New Adventures (Karel Lamac, 1943) Sea of Lost Ships (Joseph Kane, 1953) The Sea Wolf (Hobart Bosworth, 1913) The Sea Wolf (Alfred Santell, 1930) Second Best Bed (Tom Walls, 1938) The Second Mrs. Tanqueray (Dallas Bower, 1952) See America Thirst (William James Craft, 1930) See How They Run (Leslie Arliss, 1955) [Sexton Blake and the Hooded Terror] The Clue of the Second Goblet (George A. Cooper, 1928) [Sexton Blake and the Hooded Terror] Blake the Lawbreaker (George A. Cooper, 1928) [Sexton Blake and the Hooded Terror] Sexton Blake, Gambler (George A. Cooper, 1928) [Sexton Blake and the Hooded Terror] Silken Threads (George A. Cooper, 1928) [Sexton Blake and the Hooded Terror] The Great Office Mystery (George A. Cooper, 1928) [Sexton Blake and the Hooded Terror] The Mystery of the Silent Death (George A. Cooper, 1928) [Sexton Blake and the Hooded Terror] Sexton Blake and the Bearded Doctor (George A. Cooper, 1935) [Sexton Blake and the Hooded Terror] Sexton Blake and the Mademoiselle (Alex Bryce, 1935) Shadow of a Man (Michael McCarthy, 1954) Shadow of Fear (Ernest Morris, 1963) Shadow of the Eagle (Sidney Salkow, 1950) She Didn't Say No! (Cyril Frankel, 1958) She Has What It Takes (Charles Barton, 1943) She Shall Have Murder (Daniel Birt, 1950) She Wrote the Book (Charles Lamont, 1946) The She-Wolf (James Flood, 1931) Ship Café (Robert Florey, 1935) The Silent Battle (Herbert Mason, 1939) The Silent Woman (TV-movie; Joyce Buñuel, 1989) The Silk Hat Kid (H. Bruce Humberstone, 1935) The Silken Affair (Roy Kellino, 1956) A Single Life (John Power, 1985) Sisters Under the Skin (David Burton, 1934) The Sky's the Limit (Jack Buchanan and Lee Garmes, 1937) Sleeping Car (Anatole Litvak, 1933) Slightly Scarlet (Louis J. Gasnier and Edwin H. Knopf, 1930) SNAFU (Jack Moss, 1945) Snow Treasure (Irving Jacoby, 1968) Snow/Woman (Mitsuru Meike, 2000) Soldiers of Innocence (Han Woo Jung, 1989) Soldiers of the King (Maurice Elvey, 1933) Something Money Can't Buy (Pat Jackson, 1952) Something to Believe In (John Hough, 1997) Somewhere in England (John E. Blakeley, 1940) [Somewhere in England] Somewhere in Camp (John E. Blakeley, 1942) [Somewhere in England] Somewhere in Civvies (Maclean Rogers, 1943) [Somewhere in England] Somewhere in Politics (John E. Blakeley, 1948) Somewhere on Leave (John E. Blakeley, 1942) Sorrell and Son (Jack Raymond, 1933) Spartacus (Riccardo Freda, 1952) [Splinters] Splinters in the Navy (Walter Forde, 1931) [Splinters] Splinters in the Air (Alfred J. Goulding, 1937) The Sport of Kings (Victor Saville, 1931) Spy for a Day (Mario Zampi, 1939) Spy of Napoleon (Maurice Elvey, 1936) The Squeaker (Edgar Wallace, 1930) Stallion Road (James V. Kern and Raoul Walsh, 1947) Stories from a Flying Trunk (Christine Edzard, 1979) The Storm (IMDb doesn't even list this one and it's not known if it survives; Frank Reicher, 1916) The Storm (Reginald Barker, 1922) The Storm (Harold Young, 1938) Storm Over Tibet (Andrew Marton, 1951) Stormy (Lew Landers, 1935) Stormy Weather (Tom Walls, 1935) Story of a Woman (Leonardo Bercovici, 1969) Stranded (Paul Tucker, 1991) For the other 15 links in the series, here goes: Classic Zero-Star: boxd.it/SIYo Classic One-Star: boxd.it/SIYy Classic Two-Star: boxd.it/SIYS Classic Three-Star: boxd.it/SIZ2 Classic Four-Star: boxd.it/SIZc Recent Zero-Star: boxd.it/SJ8I Recent One-Star: boxd.it/SJ8S Recent Two-Star: boxd.it/SJ92 Recent Three-Star: boxd.it/SJ9w Recent Four-Star: boxd.it/SJ9G Both Guides' Total Zero-Star (Part I): boxd.it/SJjm Both Guides' Total One-Star: boxd.it/SJjw Both Guides' Total Two-Star: boxd.it/SJjG Both Guides' Total Three-Star: boxd.it/SJjQ Both Guides' Total Four-Star: boxd.it/SJk0 Gritten says that in most cases, especially for classics, he felt Halliwell's exact review was more than sufficient and kept it intact, but occasionally he strongly disagreed and if there are notes, just press 'Read Notes' and I will my best to have any additional review and discrepancy posted and noted; I'm considering putting the entire reviews up but I'm not sure yet, one way or the other. My main goal is to simply get the star-ratings up and the lists complete. Feel free to drop me a line with any comments, or just to say hello, and I hope you enjoy these lists and find them helpful!~~William Wood (Windsor, Ontario, Canada) =)
data.text:
Halliwell's zero-star entries, from both 'Halliwell's 2008 Film Guide' and 'Halliwell's: The Movies That Matter', were far too numerous, and to be able to add notes, etc., to Part II, I needed to stop it at 3200 titles and start this Part III. It officially starts, alphabetically, with, under [Marked Woman], 'Lady Gangster' and goes to 'Strange Bargain'.

As I have concluded putting the entries from 'The Movies That Matter' on the lists, I've worked out the percentages--Here goes!:

Awful: 41.45% (143 of the 345)

Fair: 26.96% (93 of the 345)

Good: 22.03% (76 of the 345)

Great: 7.54% (26 of the 345)

Masterpiece: 2.03% (7 of the 345)

As I've completed the entries from the book, the percentages are as follows (for the 21168 entries of the 2008 Film Guide):

Awful: 11882 (or 56.13%)

Fair: 5904 (or 27.89%)

Good: 2212 (or 10.45%)

Great: 869 (or 4.11%)

Masterpiece: 301 (or 1.42%)

My main goal is to simply get the star-ratings up and the lists complete.

Feel free to drop me a line with any comments, or just to say hello, and I hope you enjoy these lists and find them helpful!~~William Wood (Windsor, Ontario, Canada) =)
